posts.title: Zavjera
posts.excerpt: On its way to joining NATO, the small nation of Montenegro got in the way of the great state of Russia. Moscow agents plan to stage a coup in Mediterranean country on the day of the parliamentary elections. The goal is to remove the pro-Western prime minister and install pro-Russian rule. But an insider, a …

posts._title: Jonas Kærup Hjort – Den Næstsidste AKA The Penultimate (2020)
posts.title: Den Næstsidste
posts.excerpt: A Kafkaesque tale of an insignificant Water Inspector who arrives at a giant remote building in order to register the residents’ water meters. Before he knows of it, he finds himself trapped inside the building facing an impenetrable maze of obstacles. In his attempt to escape, perception of reality, the rational, and the remnants of …

posts._title: Melvin Frank – A Touch of Class (1973)
posts.title: A Touch of Class
posts.excerpt: IMDb wrote:Romantic comedy about a pair of clandestine lovers in a London-Spain tryst. WarnerBros wrote:They thought it would be a simple fling. Instead, they got flung. Being free and easy proves neither free nor easy for already-married Steve and divorced Vickie when they fall in love.

posts._title: Jûzô Itami – Marusa no onna AKA A Taxing Woman (1987)
posts.title: Marusa no onna
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Ace tax investigator Ryoko Itakura (Nobuko Miyamoto) sets her sights on the mysterious and philandering Hideki Gondo (Tsutomu Yamazaki), a suspected millionaire who owns a thriving chain of seedy hourly hotels. For years, Gondo has succeeded at hiding the true extent of his assets from the Japanese authorities. As the government investigation progresses, Itakura and …

posts._title: Henry Koster – A Man Called Peter (1955)
posts.title: A Man Called Peter
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Based on the true story of a young Scottish lad, Peter Marshall, who dreams of only going to sea but finds out there is a different future for him when he receives a “calling” from God to be a minister. He leaves Scotland and goes to America where after a few small congregations he lands …

posts.title: Route-3
posts.excerpt: SynopsisIn a sweaty, overcrowded tram in Sarajevo, a shy teenager is beset by every imaginable impediment as he tries to capture the attention of his object of desire.

posts._title: Serhiy Pashchenko – The Beard AKA Barada (1978)
posts.title: The Beard
posts.excerpt: “A clever parody on a foreign film.”

posts._title: Ilze Burkovska Jacobsen – My Favorite War (2020)
posts.title: My Favorite War
posts.excerpt: A personal, animated documentary about the director’s life growing up in Latvia during the Soviet era 1970-1990, where Sovjet used WW2 as an ideological weapon to suppress and scare the population.

posts._title: Andrey Khrzhanovskiy – Nos, ili zagovor netakikh AKA The Nose or The Conspiracy of Mavericks (2020)
posts.title: Nos, ili zagovor netakikh
posts.excerpt: A cheerful grim look at the follies of the twentieth century, anchored in Gogol’s proto-surrealist novella ‘The Nose’ and Shostakovich’s opera of the same name.
posts.titleEnglish: The Nose or The Conspiracy of Mavericks

posts._title: Cristian Ponce – Historia de lo Oculto (2020)
posts.title: Historia de lo Oculto
posts.excerpt: For the final broadcast of ‘60 Minutes to Midnight’, the most viewed journalistic show on television, the star of the night is Adrián Marcato, who is about to expose the president of the government’s ties to Satanism.
